newsitem.title: UNITED NATIONS: Germany contributes to buy aircraft for Sahnoun.
newsitem.headline: Germany contributes to buy aircraft for Sahnoun.

text.p: Germany on Tuesday contributed $120,000 towards buying an aircraft and communications equipment for the new U.N. envoy to Central Africa, Mohammed Sahnoun, according to Bonn's U.N. mission.

Sahnoun, an Algerian diplomat appointed as special envoy for the United Nations and the Organisation of African Unity, last week told the Security Council that he would have difficulty operating in Zaire, Rwanda and Burundi without proper transport or communications.
He said his experience as special U.N. envoy in Somalia in 1992 had shown him the difficulty of operating in remote areas without such facilities.

Diplomats said council members agreed but no one member offered any transport. A German spokesman said he hoped that Bonn's contribution would serve as an example to other countries to donate funds to the mission.
Sahnoun is currently in Washington, talking to U.S. government officials and other diplomats before leaving for the region late this week.
The German contribution was given to U.N. Secretary-General Kofi Annan on Tuesday by Dr. Werner Hoyer, minister of state at the foreign ministry, during a visit in New York.
